snippet: A victory by Senator David Vitter has long been assumed to be all but inevitable. But recent polling shows his unfavorable ratings climbing.
abstract: Sen David Vitter's polling numbers in Louisiana gubernatorial contest have dropped in wake of summer in which he was main target of Republican primary opponents Lt Gov Jay Dardenne and Scott Angelle as well as Democratic State Rep John Bel Edwards; policy differences between candidates are minimal, and race has become something of personality contest that will likely be determined by nuanced preferences Louisiana  voters have for their state politicians.
lead_paragraph: A victory by Senator David Vitter has long been assumed to be all but inevitable. But recent polling shows his unfavorable ratings climbing.

headline.print_headline: A U.S. Senator Is Everyone’s Target in a Governor’s Race
headline.main: David Vitter Is Everyone’s Target in Louisiana Governor’s Race
